Topic.Title: 128% fee increase. If they don't reverse this increase they will lose my $1500 a month

Message.Msg: As a Top Rated Seller, I am sure that you are aware that you accepted the Ebay User Agreement, which clearly states that you will not make false or disparaging remarks about Ebay. Several remarks on this board are in violation of the User Agreement. Any ebay seller identified as posting these remarks will have their Ebay privileges revoked and their account will be closed. Yahoo shares ID information and IP adresses of these violators with Ebay, so consider yourself warned. False information or postings that portray the Ebay experience in a negative light that are made by Ebay sellers will not be tolerated.
looks like you could have paid a penny if u waited until today..bummer

Topic.Title: 128% fee increase. If they don't reverse this increase they will lose my $1500 a month

Message.Msg: Are you kidding. You would threaten to suspend a customer who gives you over $20,000 a year because they don't say nice things about having their fees doubled? What do you wan't me to say? Thank you for raising my fees ebay. ebay, I am happy that I work so hard to give John Donohoe even more money. You are going to lose me as a seller anyway because I cannot afford to have my fees double or triple. I don't have the margins to deal with it. ebay is just a computer program and it costs ebay basically nothing to collect the $20,000 a year that it gets from me. I am doing all of the work and taking all of the risk. Why does ebay need to double it to $40,000. Instead ebay will get nothing. I just dont understand why ebay would forfeit the $20,000 in hopes of taking more money from me. I am sure I speak for many other sellers too. They all can't be as happy as you say to pay more fees.

Message.Msg: 55 at least today.
Ahh yes but Amazon people are not crooks, nor do you run into rooks on amazon. It almost never worth $30 to use ebay. They have no customer service and are not polite to sellers.

I never have problems with my eBay purchases, never. I purchase regularly on eBay. You just have to do a little due diligence before making your purchase. If your buying new, expect new. If you buying refurbished, expect refurbished. If you buying pre-owned, again adjust your expectations. You won't find better deals anywhere else.
And new high...it is above that stubbon resistance and will go above ma-50 to. The fundamental news today is very good. Fundamental drives the price...
Wow. Omi Channel is real.

Selling on ebay. that's where the trouble is. Its not the sellers, its ebay itself! I would not own this stock if it were the last one one earth. As a ebay user of 12 years, they finally drove me out. Sellers are being driven out and soon there will be a mass exodus when the tax man comes. Without sellers, there will be no buyers.

My 1st purchase on eBay was in the summer of 1999. I've heard of mass exodus and eBay's demise for years now, usually coming from Seller who couldn't live up to the standards eBay enforces. Except that they only keeping growing and making more and more money. Stunning that the Street still see's Amazon as more valuable yet they can't make seem to make a profit while eBay stuff's cash into it's pocket's like it's raining money.

"Ahh yes but Amazon people are not crooks" And neither is the seller who has the "Vortex 12" V-Series Fan" up for auction at $649.00. They have over 25k feedback and a 99.4% rating. So much for your theory.
